title: Prime quadruplet
summary: In number theory, a prime quadruplet (sometimes called prime quadruple) is a set of four prime numbers of the form { p , p + 2 , p + 6 , p + 8 } . {\displaystyle \{p,\ p+2,\ p+6,\ p+8\}.} [1] This represents the closest possible grouping of four primes larger than 3, and is the only prime constellation of length 4.
